content:
1
IN THE SUPREME COURT OF INDIA
CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION
CIVIL APPEAL DIARY NO(S). 17286/2025
JINDAL POWER LIMITED                              Appellant(s)
                                VERSUS
CENTRAL ELECTRICITY REGULATORY 
COMMISSION & ORS.                              Respondent(s)
O R D E R
1. Learned  counsel  appearing  for  the  appellant  seeks
permission to withdraw the present Appeal.
2. Permission as sought for is granted.
3. The Civil Appeal is dismissed as withdrawn.
..……………………J.
    [PAMIDIGHANTAM SRI NARASIMHA]
..……………………J.                                                                             
[R. MAHADEVAN]
New Delhi
04-07-2025 
  
 2
ITEM NO.14               COURT NO.12               SECTION XVII
               S U P R E M E  C O U R T  O F  I N D I A
                       RECORD OF PROCEEDINGS
CIVIL APPEAL Diary No(s). 17286/2025
[Arising out of impugned final judgment and order dated  02-12-2024
in AN No. 279/2016 passed by the Appellate Tribunal for Electricity
at New Delhi]
JINDAL POWER LIMITED                               Petitioner(s)
                                VERSUS
CENTRAL ELECTRICITY REGULATORY COMMISSION & ORS.   Respondent(s)
FOR ADMISSION 
IA No. 121052/2025 - CONDONATION OF DELAY IN FILING APPEAL
 
Date : 04-07-2025 This matter was called on for hearing today.
CORAM : 
         HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE PAMIDIGHANTAM SRI NARASIMHA
         HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE R. MAHADEVAN
         (PARTIAL COURT WORKING DAYS BENCH)
For Petitioner(s) :Mr. Sanjeev Kumar Kapoor, Adv.
                   Ms. Divya Chaturvedi, Adv.
                   Mr. Saransh Shaw, Adv.
                   Mr. Jai Dhanani, Adv.
                   M/s Khaitan & Co., AOR                   
                   
For Respondent(s) : 
          UPON hearing the counsel the Court made the following
                             O R D E R
The Civil Appeal is dismissed as withdrawn in terms of the
signed order.
 (INDU MARWAH)                             (NIDHI WASON)
 AR-cum-PS                                   COURT MASTER (NSH)
(signed order is placed on the file)
